ch.iserver.ace.collaboration.jupiter
Class CollaborationServiceImpl

java.lang.Object
  ch.iserver.ace.collaboration.jupiter.CollaborationServiceImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
CollaborationService, NetworkServiceCallback
public class CollaborationServiceImpl
extends Object
implements CollaborationService, NetworkServiceCallback

Default implementation of the CollaborationService interface.

getPublisherThreadDomain

public ThreadDomain getPublisherThreadDomain()
Gets the publisher thread domain of the collaboration service. The publisher thread domain is used by the publisher to wrap outgoing participant connections.

Returns:
the publisher thread domain

setPublisherThreadDomain

public void setPublisherThreadDomain(ThreadDomain domain)
Sets the publisher thread domain of the collaboration service.

Parameters:
domain - the new publisher thread domain

createIncomingDomain

public ThreadDomain createIncomingDomain()
Creates the thread domain for a published session. This should be a SingleThreadDomain unless you are sure that only one thread is accessing the ServerLogic and ParticipantPort objects, in which case you can use CallerThreadDomain. However, this happens mostly in test scenarios where multiple threads are unwelcome.

Returns:
the new single thread domain for the published session

getServerInfo

public ServerInfo getServerInfo()
Description copied from interface: CollaborationService
Retrieves the ServerInfo of the local server. This information is mainly useful as feedback to the local user. If may not be available right after starting. If getting the information fails, the client should periodically poll the CollaborationService for the ServerInfo object.

Specified by:
getServerInfo in interface CollaborationService
Returns:
the server info object
See Also:
CollaborationService.getServerInfo()

start

public void start()
Description copied from interface: CollaborationService
Starts the CollaborationService. No events are fired before this method is called.

Specified by:
start in interface CollaborationService
See Also:
CollaborationService.start()

stop

public void stop()
Description copied from interface: CollaborationService
Stops the CollaborationService. This method destroys the collaboration service. Do not call any methods after this method call.

Specified by:
stop in interface CollaborationService
See Also:
CollaborationService.stop()

setUserId

public void setUserId(String id)
Description copied from interface: CollaborationService
Sets the user id of the local user. This method has to be called before starting the service with the CollaborationService.start() method. Note, it is an error to set the user id twice!

Specified by:
setUserId in interface CollaborationService
Parameters:
id - the id of the local user
See Also:
CollaborationService.setUserId(java.lang.String)

discoverUser

public void discoverUser(DiscoveryCallback callback,
                         InetAddress addr,
                         int port)
Description copied from interface: CollaborationService
Initiates an explicit discovery of a user. The network layer tries to contact the given host on the given port. The result is communicated to the DiscoveryCallback objects.

Specified by:
discoverUser in interface CollaborationService
Parameters:
callback - the DiscoveryCallback to be notified
addr - the target address
port - the target port
See Also:
CollaborationService.discoverUser(ch.iserver.ace.collaboration.DiscoveryCallback, java.net.InetAddress, int)

invitationReceived

public void invitationReceived(InvitationProxy proxy)
Description copied from interface: NetworkServiceCallback
Notifies the callback that an invitation was received. The passed in invitation can be used to accept or reject the invitation.

invitationReceived in interface NetworkServiceCallback
Parameters:
proxy - the Invitation object that allows to accept or reject the invitation
